meta_description: The Mount is the home of Edith Wharton in Lenox, MA - the Berkshires. Historic Tours, Weddings, Music, Events, Outdoor Sculpture, Cafe. Close to Tanglewood, Shakespeare & Co., Red Lion Inn

#### History & Beauty, Without the Velvet Ropes

## Hours

**November – December:  
**The Main House & Bookstore are open Saturdays and Sundays, 10 am – 3 pm

The Terrace Café is closed.

**Important** : We sometimes close early due to special events (especially on Saturday). [View early closing dates](https://edithwharton.org/events/).

The grounds are free and open daily from dawn to dusk, unless otherwise posted.

## Contact

Main number: (413) 551-5111

## Directions

#### 2 Plunkett Street (at the corner of Route 7) Lenox, MA

The Mount is located in the Berkshires of Western Massachusetts and is close to Tanglewood, the Norman Rockwell Museum, Mass MoCA and many other Berkshire attractions.

  * 2 hours from Boston
  * 2.5 hours from NYC
  * GPS Coordinates: Latitude: 42.335579, Longitude: -73.2829

## Admission

All onsite [exhibits](https://edithwharton.org/exhibits-at-the-house/) are included with admission to the Main House. Purchase tickets **[here.](https://fareharbor.com/embeds/book/edithwharton/?full-items=yes&flow=425016)** You do not need to purchase a ticket to visit the [Terrace Café](https://edithwharton.org/cafe/) or [Bookstore](https://edithwharton.org/shop/). The grounds and gardens are currently open, free-of-charge.

accessibility_text:
The Mount welcomes visitors of all abilities and backgrounds. If you have a mobility, visual, or hearing impairment, we are here to help. Caregivers are admitted free of charge. The Mount offers handicapped parking and accessible restrooms at the Main House and Stable, and an elevator in the Main House.

The Mount is a Massachusetts Cultural Council UP designated organization welcoming participants of all abilities.

Please contact us at 413-551-5100 or email at [info@edithwharton.org](mailto:info@edithwharton.org) to discuss any accommodations you may need for your visit.

## Community, Creativity & Storytelling

## Come experience **ART** that awakens, **PROGRAMS** that enliven, NATURE that nourishes, and [STORIES](https://edithwharton.org/discover/edith-wharton/) that inspire.

  * [ ](https://edithwharton.org/discover/edith-wharton/ "Discover Edith Wharton")

##  [Discover Edith Wharton](https://edithwharton.org/discover/edith-wharton/ "Discover Edith Wharton")

The Mount is a turn-of-the-century home, designed and built by Edith Wharton in 1902.

  * [ ](https://edithwharton.org/programs "Join a Program")

##  [Join a Program](https://edithwharton.org/programs "Join a Program")

Join us for author talks and discussions, music, readings, art, and children's programs. There is something for everyone!

  * [ ](https://edithwharton.org/discover/the-gardens/ "Explore the Grounds")

##  [Explore the Grounds](https://edithwharton.org/discover/the-gardens/ "Explore the Grounds")

Our trails and historic gardens are free to the public and open dawn to dusk all year.

  * [ ](https://edithwharton.org/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Red-and-Black-Bold-Simple-Book-Club-Presentation.jpg)

#### **Join The Mount online Book Club!**

Join us online for lively discussions of Edith Wharton’s acclaimed works. This year’s selections are _Old New York,_  _Glimpses of the Moon_ , and _Madame de Treymes,_ along with Henry James’ _Madame de Mauves_. Book Club conversations are free; however, registration is required.
